newsitem.title: POLAND: UTA MULLS FACTORY IN POLAND-OFFICIAL.
newsitem.headline: UTA MULLS FACTORY IN POLAND-OFFICIAL.

text.p: United Technologies Automotive (UTA), a subsidiary of United Technologies Corp, wants to build a car-part factory in the special Polish economic zone in Mielec, an official from the zone said on Wednesday.

"We are in the last stage of the negotiations of UTA's entering the zone ... by the end of November the factory should be built, and production will start in November or December," the zone's promotion director Janusz Sobon told Reuters.
In Poland's special economic zones investors are exempt from corporate tax, now at 38 percent, for 10 years, and enjoy a 50-percent reduction in the tax during the next 10 years.
Sobon said the factory would first employ 500 but later the number of workers could be increased to above 1,000.
UTA's officials were not immediately available for comment.
